sentence.Network_en: The kidnappers had threatened to behead all four unless their jailed comrades were released.
sentence.Network_cn: 帮匪们曾经威胁说如果印度方面不释放他们的同伙,他们就要将这四名人质全部斩首.

sentence.Network_en: It needed only a fraction of a second to behead him.
sentence.Network_cn: 砍去他的脑袋只要短短的一瞬.

sentence.Network_en: Some day, with additional two capital punishment a ask behead.
sentence.Network_cn: 某日, 与另两位死刑犯一道问斩.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  behēafdian; from be- 'off' (expressing removal) + hēafod (see head)

entry.def: If someone is beheaded, their head is cut off, usually because they have been found guilty of a crime.

example.ex: Charles I was beheaded by the Cromwellians.
example.tran: 查理一世被克伦威尔派斩首。

sentences.sentence: "the French King was beheaded during the Revolution"

auth_sentence.content: "We're going to behead them," the kidnapper told her.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: "We're going to behead them," the kidnapper told her.

auth_sentence.content: So the release of two suspects held over the alleged plot to behead a British Muslim soldier was a gift from heaven.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: So the release of two suspects held over the alleged plot to behead a British Muslim soldier was a gift from heaven.

auth_sentence.content: The general says the Taliban took advantage of the lull in fighting to behead and beat locals who had opposed them.

sentences.en: He was beheaded for high treason.
